docs.name: MaterialSliderComponent
docs.comment:
A material slider which works for integer values.

The slider can be controlled by dragging it with the mouse, or by using the keyboard. In LTR, Left/down arrow keys decrease the value by 1, up/right keys increase by 1, page up increases by 10% (rounded up) and page down decreases by 10% (rounded up). In RTL, the keys have the opposite effect.

WARNING when using double values floating point math can cause the values to be non-exact. If displaying the value to the user consider formatting the result.

inputs.name: max
inputs.comment:
The maximum progress value.

Defaults to 100, must be strictly larger than min.

inputs.name: min
inputs.comment:
The minimum progress value.

Defaults to 0, must be strictly smaller than max.

inputs.name: step
inputs.comment:
The step size of the input.

Must be a positive number and a divisor of (max - min).

inputs.name: value
inputs.comment:
The current value of the input value element.

When isTwoSided is true, then this represents the current value of the right slider knob. Must be between min and max, inclusive, a multiple of step, and greater than leftValue.

outputs.name: leftValueChange
outputs.comment: Publishes events when the value of the leftValue input is changed by the user in a 2 sided slider.

outputs.name: valueChange
outputs.comment: Publishes events when the value of the value input is changed by the user.
